Race.SummaryText: Parishwide Home Rule Charter Amendment Proposition
Race.FullText: Shall Section 5-301 of the Home Rule Charter of the City of New Orleans be amended to change the composition of the membership of the Sewerage and Water Board to remove one citizen member and include the chair of the Public Works, Sanitation, and Environment Committee of the New Orleans City Council or its successor committee, a member of the committee appointed by the chair, or a civil engineer appointed by the chair?

Race.SpecificTitle: Touro Bouligny Security District -- 16 2/10 Mills Renewal - CC - 8 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of New Orleans renew the levy of the Touro Bouligny Security District ("District") special tax on taxable property located within the District (except parcels whose owner qualifies under the Louisiana Special Assessment Level under Article VII, Section 18(G)(1) of the Louisiana Constitution), subject to the Homestead Exemption, which District is comprised of that area of the City within and including the following perimeter street and avenues: Louisiana Avenue to St. Charles Avenue (river side only) to Napoleon Avenue (both sides) to Magazine Street (both sides) and back to Louisiana Avenue (excluding all municipal numbers on Louisiana Avenue), as specified by Resolution R-18-334 of the New Orleans City Council, in an amount not to exceed sixteen and two-tenths (16 2/10) mills annually for eight (8) years, beginning January 1, 2019 and ending December 31, 2026, with $470,000 estimated to be collected from said special levy annually, to be used exclusively to promote and encourage security in the District as determined and managed by the Board of Commissioners of the District, and any additional security shall be supplemental to and not in lieu of personnel and services provided in the District by the New Orleans Police Department?
